Uses of Class
asypad.shapes.Line

  • Packages that use Line 
    Package Description
    asypad.shapes
    This package contains the shapes that are used to store the shapes drawn onto the screen by the user.

    • Uses of Line in asypad.shapes

      Methods in asypad.shapes with parameters of type Line 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static double Utility.distToL(double x, double y, Line l)
      Calculates the distance from (x, y) to the line l.
      static double Utility.footX(double x, double y, Line l)
      Finds the x-coordinate of the foot from (x, y) to line l.
      static double Utility.footY(double x, double y, Line l)
      Finds the y-coordinate of the foot from (x, y) to line l.
      static boolean Utility.intersect(Line l1, Line l2)
      Checks if 2 lines intersect using the cross product method.
      static double Utility.intersectX(Line l, Circle c, boolean identifier)
      Calculates an intersection point between the line and the circle.
      static double Utility.intersectX(Line l1, Line l2)
      The x-value of the point that lies on both lines.
      static double Utility.intersectY(Line l, Circle c, boolean identifier)
      Calculates an intersection point between the line and the circle.
      static double Utility.intersectY(Line l1, Line l2)
      The y-value of the point that lies on both lines.
      Constructors in asypad.shapes with parameters of type Line 
      Constructor and Description
      Line(Point p, Line l, boolean isParallel)
      Constructs line through specified point that is parallel or perpendicular to specified line.
      Point(Line l, Circle c, boolean identifier)
      Constructs an intersection point between a line and a circle with no label.
      Point(Line l, Circle c, boolean identifier, java.lang.String name)
      Constructs an intersection point between a line and a circle.
      Point(Line l1, Line l2)
      Constructs an intersection point between lines l1 and l2 with no label.
      Point(Line l1, Line l2, java.lang.String name)
      Constructs an intersection point between lines l1 and l2.
